channel.title: Server Help
channel.description:
For some strange reason my client boots and allows me too make the server but then crashes. Through trial and error I found that it crashed after 2 clicks. (regardless where or how) I searched this and I only got fixes with downgrading your Java or some windows code. I need a fix that can work using Linux without downgrading Java or fancy 10 page terminal or shell script. I am new with Linux so please help out.
-Atma

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @atma atma
item.description:
@atma wrote:

Thanks for your help Admin and community member. I appreciate it.

-Atma

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

It’s a package not a packet.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @atma atma
item.description:
@atma wrote:

Thank you, I will proceed to download this packet and with luck resolve this issue. If you want to trim posts like this add a sticky with the required packet for 64 bit users. This will help with the posts like this one.

-Atma

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“atma, post:7, topic:371211”]Can I make it clear to you my mod friends? Can I or can I not edit below code to get Mopar to not fail within 2 clicks.

#!/bin/sh
java -noverify -Xmx500m -cp .:./MoparScape.jar: Bot 0
#param 0 for highmem, 1 for lowmem

I ask for you not to call me a “Hurr Durr” and not to be mean to a new member of the community. Please give me a yes or no answer, if I can change this code?

-Atma[/quote]

You just have to edit it so it uses the 32-bit JVM instead, just like I said in my last post. (right now, ‘java’ starts the 64-bit JVM)

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @atma atma
item.description:
@atma wrote:

Can I make it clear to you my mod friends? Can I or can I not edit below code to get Mopar to not fail within 2 clicks.

#!/bin/sh
java -noverify -Xmx500m -cp .:./MoparScape.jar: Bot 0
#param 0 for highmem, 1 for lowmem

I ask for you not to call me a “Hurr Durr” and not to be mean to a new member of the community. Please give me a yes or no answer, if I can change this code?

-Atma

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @atma atma
item.description:
@atma wrote:

Will this packet will allow me to keep my 64 bit OS, but give me the opportunity to start the code freely? If you could simply give me new code to paste into the Boot file, would be a better solution? Thanks for all the help.

-Atma

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“atma, post:3, topic:371211”]I am running the 64 bit OS. Is there any way I can work around this by changing the start code for the Linux App?

-Atma[/quote]

There is a way, it’s just an extremely hacky way of doing it. You need to install the 32-bit JVM and then start the client with that instead. If you are using ubuntu or similar, the package ‘ia32-sun-java6-bin’ should do what you need, otherwise just install it from java.com

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @atma atma
item.description:
@atma wrote:

I am running the 64 bit OS. Is there any way I can work around this by changing the start code for the Linux App?

-Atma

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

‘Crashing after 2 clicks’ is due to using the 317 client on a 64-bit VM, it happens on all operating systems that I am aware of. Are you running a 64-bit OS?

Read full topic
